On Sep 22, 2012, at 9:45 AM, Steve Klabnik wrote:

>> Bookmarking is an in=
herent aspect of RESTful systems. Bookmarking is not coupling. It is the ot=
her way round: because clients will bookmark, servers pretty much have an i=
mplicit obligation to maintain URIs over time once they 'got out'.
> 
> Uh,=
 "I'm a server, I need to keep this URI because clients use it" is
> pretty=
 much textbook coupling.


It's been there from day one:

http://www.w3.org=
/Provider/Style/URI.html

It's a best practice resulting from TBL intention=
ally dropping referential integrity.

Jan
